title: ROMAN NUMERALS
guide:
# Roman Numerals Guide

## Basic Symbols

| Symbol | Value |
|---|---|
| I | 1 |
| V | 5 |
| X | 10 |
| L | 50 |
| C | 100 |
| D | 500 |
| M | 1000 |

## Rules

1. **Addition**: If a symbol comes after a larger (or equal) symbol, add it.  
   Example: `VI` = 5 + 1 = 6

2. **Subtraction**: If a symbol comes before a larger symbol, subtract it.  
   Example: `IV` = 5 - 1 = 4

> [!NOTE]
> Standard Roman Numerals only support values up to 3,999 (MMMCMXCIX) because we lack a standard symbol for 5,000 or 10,000 in ASCII.
